paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR V30M variant in the context of familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP) and its effects on disease pathology and treatment.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: We treated 4.5-month-old Hsf/V30M mice, thus before TTR starts to deposit in the peripheral nervous system.
Age-matched control Hsf/V30M untreated mice were injected with phosphate buffer saline (PBS, n = 10).

functional_data.summary: The TTR V30M variant leads to the formation of non-fibrillar deposits in the peripheral nervous system.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the Hsf/V30M mouse model.
variants.additional_notes: The study utilized a transgenic mouse model to assess the effects of the TTR V30M variant.
key_quotes: The most common TTR mutation in FAP results from an exchange of a methionine for a valine at position 30 – TTR V30M.
Treated mice presented a markedly reduction on TTR deposition in sciatic nerve (43%) as compared to non-treated animals.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR V30M variant.
